abstract: During jokes about “Cats” and the Golden Globes ceremony as a whole, Gervais, the host, used expletives that NBC had to censor.
lead_paragraph: Bleeps happen. Especially during live awards shows. But they usually result from expletives that have slipped from the mouths of winners — out of excitement, passion, even anger. Not during Sunday night’s Golden Globes, when the host Ricky Gervais, never one to bite his tongue, was bleeped twice by NBC during his prepared monologue.
